meanings.definition: Ready to face and endure danger or pain
meanings.sent1: The firefighter was braver than anyone else in the team during the rescue mission.
meanings.sent2: She felt braver when her best friend held her hand tightly.
meanings.sent3: The little puppy tried to act braver than he really was when faced with the vacuum cleaner.
meanings.sent4: Her braver decision to speak up in class made a big impact on her confidence.
meanings.sent5: The soldier's braver spirit inspired his comrades to push forward despite the challenging conditions.

meanings.sent1: The braver knight fearlessly faced the dragon to save the princess.
meanings.sent2: The braver students stood up to the bully and protected their friend.
meanings.sent3: The braver squirrel fearlessly challenged the bigger squirrel for the last acorn.
meanings.sent4: Her braver act of kindness towards the stray cat touched everyone's hearts.
meanings.sent5: The braver explorer ventured into the unknown jungle with determination and courage.

meanings.definition: More courageous than someone or something else
meanings.sent1: He was braver than his brother when it came to trying new things.
meanings.sent2: The braver lion led the pack through the treacherous terrain.
meanings.sent3: The braver flower stood out among the rest in the garden with its vibrant colors.
meanings.sent4: Her braver decision to confront her fears set her on a path to personal growth.
meanings.sent5: The braver athlete surpassed all expectations and won the championship.
